directions module¶

Original Developer: Jonathan Ward Purpose of Module: To pull directions data from the Google Maps API. Last Modified: 7/16/15 Last Modified By: Jonathan Ward Last Modification Purpose: To clarify naming and add citations. Citations:

(http://seewah.blogspot.com/2009/11/gpolyline-decoding-in-python.html)
  • See Wah Chang
directions.build_coordinate_list(start, end)[source]¶

Applies decoding functions to Google API response

directions.build_directions(origin, destination)[source]¶

Pulls directions from Google API

directions.decode_polyline(encoded)[source]¶

See (http://code.google.com/apis/maps/documentation/polylinealgorithm.html) and (See Wah Chang) for exposition of polyline decoding method.

directions.decode_polylines(polylines)[source]¶

decodes a list of polylines

directions.get_directions(start, end)[source]¶

Fetchs directions if they are already cached, else builds them.

directions.http_to_string(http_data)[source]¶

Reads HTTP bytecode response and converts it to a string

directions.string_to_polylines(string_data)[source]¶

Converts Directions string to JSON and extracts the polylines.
